    Distressed People from Price rise: When will Government wake up

    Nagendra Chatterjee     4 minute read    Read in Hindi   HOME    August 01, 2021   

    Government must come forward with such policies that can yield benefits for common man. Providing work, food and employment is government’s job but from the weak policies of present government, people are going to have any comfort, is invisible till far off the sight, means everything is running ad-hoc.

    Translated from महँगाई से जनता परेशान: कब जागेगी सरकार

    Price rise at one end has become the neck brace for the government at the other end it has become serious problem for the peoples of the country. In due course of time with the price rise and corruption, the situation in country is such that rich are becoming more richer and badly broken-down poor are becoming poorer. The Covid-19 pandemic and lockdown left its deep impact on the production process and employment and created big economic crisis. In these days middle class family is suffering worst from the price rise. The problem of price rise has become a ghost and common man is forced to live miserably. In the present time, a common man finds difficulty in sustaining its family by finding a work. Even it is becoming hard to meet out the basic necessities of food, cloth and shelter. The prices of fuels and cooking gas is sky-rocketing and central government instead of controlling the prices, is showing her indifference. The prices of petrol and diesel has reached all time high level this rise has its cascading effect on rise of prices of other things. Due to the Pandemic, there is no rise in income but expenses are rising. It is becoming difficult to balance income and expenditure. Already the job loss and salary deduction in the pandemic has been experienced, the price situation is adding up the troubles. Employment and day to day activities have already been hampered, the price rise of fuel and cost of other commodities are further adding up to the difficulties.

    The retails inflation rate has reached to 6.3 percent in the month of May, it is higher than the projection of RBI. RBI projected it between 2 to 6 percent. The statistics released by government states that after a reduction at 4.23 percent in April, the retail inflation rate in May shown a rapid rise of 6.3 percent. Retail Inflation measured on Consumer Price Index, has been caused by rise in price of fuels and high-quality foods. In the last five months the inflation has crossed the RBIs projection of 2-6 percent. REUTERS sponsored survey already suggested that the inflation in the month of May could be 5.3 percent, it is fact that the food inflation was 5.01 percent in May while it was 2.02 percent in April. The general inflation in May remained at rate of 6.6 percent. Earlier released Whole Sale Price Index based inflation figure states that rise in price of crude oil and their products caused it at 12.94 percent high level. Specialists are worried for the inflation and second wave of Covid-19 Pandemic, which has badly rocked people in low and middle-income groups.

    For the daily usable commodities like edible oils, pulses, the price has gone up sharply between March 2020 and March 2021. Prices of medicines are becoming so expensive that people are not in position to buy them. The prices of food items rose by 5 percent in month of April. The rise in price for primary sector goods has been 10.16 percent and 9.01 for the manufactured goods. Till these goods reach the market, the consumers are to pay very high fee. This is taking place when there is deep depression, steadily running unemployment, falling purchasing power and rising level of hunger. People are advised for nutritious foods, but for the reasons of unemployment and falling incomes, the expenses are curtailed. Daily wage earners and workers from informal sectors are badly hit as they don’t have any certain income.

    It is not like that our country has any food shortage. Actually, for the reason of black marketing of essential commodities the prices are rising up. Some economists of country have done some research work on this subject. The central point of their study was determination of price rise. How is price determined? What causes price rise? How it could be determined on time? So on. It has become a challenge to meet the family expenses out of the monthly salary. It is fact that in last decade India and her economy has developed but till today the poor are not getting the amenities that they deserve. The reason is clear, whatsoever the government claims but the inflation and corruption are at the critical limit and government is just a silent viewer. The reason of inflation is no government control on market, at the same time black marketing and disaster has made it worse. Obviously, there is black marketing and hoarding of essential goods and the institutions that curb and control inflation and price rise are not active. It seems that government is only planning but incapable in their total implementation.

    In the course of pandemic, the main motif of price hike in edible oil is to gain very high profit in retail trade. Once the prices of essential commodities go up then they do not come down shortly. Not only edible oils, the grocery items and vegetable prices also have gone up by many times. This is badly influencing the budget of middle-class man. Government must come forward with such policies that can yield benefits for common man. Providing work, food and employment are government’s job but, from the weak policies of present government people are going to have any comfort, is invisible till far off the sight, means everything is running ad-hoc.
